page.title: 13Auction Mart Carlisle
page.content: The Harrison & Hetherington Borderway Auction Mart stands conveniently close to the Rosehill junction of the M6. Opened in 1974, it replaced the mart at the back of Botchergate. There are weekly sales of cattle, pigs, and sheep; also agricultural equipment and crops. On 1/7/85, farmers came from as far afield as Cornwall and Aberdeen; one spent Â£70,000 on livestock; the highest price paid for a cow was Â£1050 and for a sheep, Â£44. On 28/10/85, 111 tonnes of hay and 246 tonnes of straw fetched high prices (best quality hay over Â£100 and straw over Â£40 per tonne) presumably because of the fodder crops ruined by the wet summer. Bullocks averaged 101.7p per kg, heifers 98.8p, lambs 157.7p and pigs 81.3p. A champion Blonde d'Aqu- itaine bull was sold for 4,300 guineas on 25/10/85.
